intro: Tournefortia caeciliana, commonly known as the Caeciliana turpentine tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
